page.title: 02Farming and Forestry
page.content: There are three distinct farming belts in this area.The flood plain is mainly pasture.The scarp has fruit trees,decidious and coniferous woodland.The coniferous woodland until recently was managed by the forestry commission,but they have ceased to do so. By far the most interesting area is on top of the scarp.A small field within the grounds owned by the B.B.C. Wood Norton,is closely monitored by the Worcestershire Nature Conservancy Trust and is natural meadow containing a varied variety of plants.The whole area on top of the scarp was once given over almost totally to fruit trees.It was one of the areas that gave Evesham it's name for fruit. However,recent years have seen the removal of plum,pear and apple orchards,although many still remain. Cereal production has replaced fruit.
